text.p: Norstan Inc said on Tuesday that a surge in integration services business paced the rise in revenues and total bookings during the second quarter, contributing to the company's strongest operating profitability in nearly five years.

"We are also very encouraged by the growth of our integration services business -- bookings were up more than 100 percent from a year ago and it is becoming a substantial part of our total revenues," said co-chairman and chief executive officer Paul Baszucki, in an earnings statement.

The company earlier reported record results for its fiscal second quarter to November 2, with net income up 25 pct to $2.7 million, from $2.1 million in the year-ago period. Net income per share rose 17 percent to $0.28 from $0.24 a year earlier.

Total bookings for the first six months rose to a record $185.5 million from $154.7 million in the year-ago period, it said. Growth in integration services stemmed mainly from added bookings from Connect Computer and "continued strength" in cabling and Norstan Integration Services.
Norstan provides integrated voice, video and data technology solutions. It shares rose one to 16-3/4.
